name: Tokyo Skytree
description: A broadcasting and observation tower in Sumida, Tokyo. It became the tallest structure in Japan in 2010 and reached its full height of 634.0 metres (2,080 ft) in March 2011, making it the tallest tower in the world, displacing the Canton Tower, and the second tallest structure in the world after the Burj Khalifa.
address: 1 Chome-1-2 Oshiage, Sumida City, Tokyo 131-0045, Japan

name: Shibuya Crossing
description: A large, busy intersection in Shibuya, Tokyo, famous for its scramble crossing. It is one of the busiest intersections in the world, with thousands of pedestrians crossing at once.
address: 1 Chome-2 Dogenzaka, Shibuya City, Tokyo 150-0043, Japan

name: Senso-ji Temple
description: An ancient Buddhist temple located in Asakusa, Tokyo, Japan. It is Tokyo's oldest temple, and one of its most significant. Formerly the main temple of the Tendai sect of Buddhism, it became independent after World War II.
address: 2 Chome-3-1 Asakusa, Taito City, Tokyo 111-0032, Japan
opening_hours: Main Hall 6:00 AM - 5:00 PM (April-September), 6:30 AM - 5:00 PM (October-March)

name: Meiji Jingu
description: A Shinto shrine dedicated to the enshrined spirits of Emperor Meiji and his consort, Empress Shoken. Located in a forest that covers an area of 70 hectares (170 acres) in Shibuya, Tokyo, the shrine is a popular spot for traditional Japanese weddings.

name: Ginza
description: A district of Chuo, Tokyo, known as an upscale shopping area with numerous department stores, boutiques, restaurants, and coffeehouses. It is considered one of the most luxurious shopping districts in the world.
opening_hours: Varies by shop/restaurant, generally 11:00 AM - 8:00 PM

name: Tokyo National Museum
description: The oldest and largest national museum in Japan, located in Ueno Park, Tokyo. It collects, houses, and preserves a comprehensive collection of art works and archaeological objects of Asia, with a focus on Japan.

name: Akihabara
description: A vibrant district in Tokyo known for its electronics stores, anime and manga shops, and maid cafés. It is a major center for otaku (diehard fan) culture.
opening_hours: Varies by shop, generally 10:00 AM - 8:00 PM

name: Imperial Palace
description: The primary residence of the Emperor of Japan. It is a large park-like area located in the Chiyoda ward of Tokyo and contains several buildings including the main palace, the private residences of the Imperial Family, an archive, museums and administrative offices.
opening_hours: East Garden: Tuesday-Thursday, Saturday-Sunday 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM (closed Mondays, Fridays)

name: Tsukiji Outer Market
description: A bustling public market in Tokyo, famous for its fresh seafood and produce. While the inner wholesale market moved to Toyosu, the outer market remains a popular spot for tourists and locals to enjoy fresh food and culinary goods.
address: 4 Chome-16-2 Tsukiji, Chuo City, Tokyo 104-0045, Japan

name: Ghibli Museum
description: A museum showcasing the work of the Japanese animation studio Studio Ghibli. Located in Mitaka, western Tokyo, it features exhibits, a short film theater, and a rooftop garden.
opening_hours: Wednesday-Monday 10:00 AM - 5:00 PM (closed Tuesdays, advance tickets required)
